golgui.components

Class GuiComponentFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • golgui.components.GuiComponentFactory

  • public class GuiComponentFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a factory object that creates basic pacman.components of the application.
    Version:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  GuiComponentFactory.TranslucentScrollBarUI
      Contains a scrollbar UI that modifies the standard swing's UI, making the scrollbar UI translucent.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private GuiComponentFactory()
      Method that hides the constructor since the factory does not need initialization.

        height - the absolute height of this area
        isTransparent - transparency
        Returns:
        a new JPanel with required width, height and transparency

                                                    int fontSize,
                                                    java.awt.Color textColor)
        This function would create a JLabel with transparent background and white text. Font is set to be Sans-Serif by default
        Parameters:
        text - the string in this JLabel
        fontSize - the size of the font
        textColor - the color of the text
        Returns:
        a JLabel with text, color and size specified.

        Parameters:
        field - the JTextField object

      • createTextField

        public static javax.swing.JTextField createTextField(java.lang.Integer width)
        Creates a simple text field which asks for input.
        Parameters:
        width - the maximum number of columns in the JTextField. null if such information is not needed and will not set a maximum width
        Returns:
        a textfield which allows the user to send input

        Parameters:
        emptyStringPolicy - a flag stands for the policy that how the JFormattedTextField treats an empty string
        Returns:
        a textfield which allows the user to send numeric input

      • createIconOfButton

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon createIconOfButton(java.lang.String path,
                                                       java.awt.Color textColor)
        Creates an icon that can be used on buttons. The icon changes its color to fit the text color in the application.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the image file containing the icon
        textColor - the color for the text
        Returns:
        the icon object

      • createButtonWithIcon

        public static javax.swing.JButton createButtonWithIcon(java.lang.String path,
                                                       java.lang.String text,
                                                       java.awt.Color textColor)
        This function would create a JButton with Flat design and an icon: Hover effect, grey background and no border. Need to set font manually after calling this function.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the image file containing the icon
        text - if the icon cannot be found, text will appear on the button
        textColor - the color for the text
        Returns:
        a new JButton with icon or text label

      • createGridBagConstraints

        public static java.awt.GridBagConstraints createGridBagConstraints(int x,
                                                                   int y)
        Creates a GridBagConstraints that set the x,y coordinate of a component used for adding such component to another component which uses the GridBagLayout.
        Parameters:
        x - Specifies the cell containing the leading edge of the component's display area, where the first cell in a row has gridx=0
        y - Specifies the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has y = 0
        Returns:
        the GridBagConstraints object that will be used to add the component

      • createGridBagConstraints

        public static java.awt.GridBagConstraints createGridBagConstraints(int x,
                                                                   int y,
                                                                   int width,
                                                                   int height)
        Creates a GridBagConstraints that set the x,y coordinate and also the width and height of a component used for adding such component to another component which uses the GridBagLayout.
        Parameters:
        x - Specifies the cell containing the leading edge of the component's display area, where the first cell in a row has gridx=0
        y - Specifies the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has y = 0
        height - the number of cells in a row for the component's display area
        width - the number of cells in a column for the component's display area
        Returns:
        the GridBagConstraints object that will be used to add the component

      • createCheckBox

        static javax.swing.JCheckBox createCheckBox(java.lang.String text,
                                            java.awt.Color textColor)
        This function will create a flat design JCheckBox: transparent background, white text with font size 18.
        Parameters:
        text - text appearing next to the check box
        textColor - the color of the text
        Returns:
        a new transparent JCheckBox

        public static javax.swing.JFileChooser createFileChooser(java.lang.String defaultName)
        This function would create a JFileChooser for saving/loading feature.
        Parameters:
        defaultName - the default file name
        Returns:
        a file chooser with txt as the default extension choice and "All types" option allowed

      • createComboBox

        public static <K> javax.swing.JComboBox<K> createComboBox(java.awt.Color hoverColor,
                                                          java.awt.Color backgroundColor,
                                                          java.awt.Color textColor)
        This function will create a flat design JComboBox: transparent background, dark popup menu and white text.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the combo box item
        Parameters:
        hoverColor - Color for background when the user moves the cursor over it
        backgroundColor - Color for background
        textColor - Color for text
        Returns:
        a new JComboBox

      • wrapInEquallyDividedPanel

        public static javax.swing.JPanel wrapInEquallyDividedPanel(java.awt.Component... comps)
        This function wraps multiple pacman.components into one JPanel and let them equally divided into areas.
        Parameters:
        comps - different pacman.components that are about to be added
        Returns:
        a JPanel containing all pacman.components in comps

      • wrapInEquallyDividedPanelFixedHeight

        public static javax.swing.JPanel wrapInEquallyDividedPanelFixedHeight(java.awt.Component... comps)
        This function wraps multiple pacman.components into one JPanel and let them equally divided into areas. This function does not resize vertically.
        Parameters:
        comps - different pacman.components that are about to be added
        Returns:
        a JPanel containing all pacman.components in comps

      • wrapInPanel

        public static javax.swing.JPanel wrapInPanel(java.awt.Component... comps)
        This function wraps multiple pacman.components into one JPanel and does not change the way how they are divided into areas.
        Parameters:
        comps - different pacman.components that are about to be added
        Returns:
        a JPanel containing all pacman.components in comps

                                               java.awt.Component relation,
                                               boolean blank)
        This function creates a dialog.
        Parameters:
        text - the text on the dialog
        relation - the location of which this dialog is relative to
        blank - should there be empty area around the text
        Returns:
        the dialog instance

      • createCounter

        public static javax.swing.JPanel createCounter(javax.swing.JLabel stepCountLabel,
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               java.awt.Color textColor)
        Creates a counter with a label that will be used in this application for statistical data, such as tick number.
        Parameters:
        stepCountLabel - the label containing the number
        name - the name containing the purpose of this counter
        textColor - the color of text
        Returns:
        a JPanel which contains the counter and all related pacman.components
